content.description: Face climb to the right of No Name
content.location: Walk off to climbers left for 3rd class descent

content.description: Face climb to the left of the main crack. Climbs to a good finger crack.
content.protection: TR by hiking 3rd class to the left of the slab. Use the tree as an anchor.
content.location: Route just to the left of the main crack. Descend the 3rd class to climber's left.

content.description: Very easy route for new climbers/leaders looking for a first trad lead. Walk off to climbers left on 3rd class terrain.
content.protection: Cams, one each .6-2", long cordelette for natural anchor on tree.

content.description: Climb the face just to the left of Dirty Thirty. 5.10- move off the ground to thin 5.10. Crux comes at the top with a couple slopers and thin feet. Great climb for the length. Crux goes 5.10b/c or so.
content.protection:
I'd say this is PG13 due to the lack of bomber gear for the anchor.

Gear anchor, but kind of hard to find solid placements. Expect to extend all your pieces. We were able to use a .75 Camalot high and right, a .3 for our middle piece, and a .5 low and left.

Planning for a bolted anchor and possibly bolting the route for sport in the near future.
content.location: The face just left of Dirty Thirty. Walk off the 4th class terrain over the top. Go right at the top and look for a gully to descend.

content.description:
A couple options here, climbing the seam/face goes 5.8+/5.9-. Climbing from the face to the arete seams a little easier with a couple of big jugs on the arete, maybe 5.8. There's still potential for a trad lead, but likely won't be good gear. Walk off above TR anchor on 4th class terrain. Go right and find a gully to descend to base.

Bolts are planned for a TR anchor in the near future.
content.protection:
I'd say this is PG13 just for the lack of bomber placements for anchor building.

We were able to use a .75 C4 and a .5 X4 with a long cordelette for a TR anchor. Some potentially loose blocks, so be sure to choose wisely.
content.location: Far right in the thin seam.
